channel.title: Htpc
channel.description:
So I made a pretty decent HTPC last year (I will spare you all the specs), I gave it 1.4 TB of storage thinking that should be plenty...
well, 12 months of netflicks (rip & return) has filled my drives and now I am looking to expand my storage capabilities. Does anyone know a maker / source for really small rack mounts? like 14 U or something. So far I am just keeping an eye on craigslist, but living in the southeast USA doesnt make it easy to obtain second hand hardware.
Anyone else have the same issue I am? What are you doing for your data storage? If I just went with a tower, anyone have some recommendations for data storage? (ie, good cooling, lots of bays, etc)
PS, hello everyone. It has been a while since I have been here.

They can still check your logs.

item.title: Htpc
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

With as cheap as storage is getting, you should be able just to swap out a hard drive with a much bigger one if you don’t have room for more hard drives. This is what I am going to have to do once I get enough money for a bigger hardrive. Currently, all of my SATA and ATA ports are taken up, not to mention that I’ve had to take out my A: drive to fit the last hard drive in. Here is my current storage situation:

mopar@killer-linux:~$ df -h Filesystem Size Used Avail Use% Mounted on /dev/sdd3 37G 32G 3.2G 91% / /dev/sda1 230G 229G 1G 98% /home/mopar/isokingdom /dev/sdc1 230G 200G 19G 92% /home/mopar/ext3store /dev/sdd1 426G 387G 40G 91% /home/mopar/bigdaddy /dev/sdb1 98G 68G 30G 70% /home/mopar/vista /dev/sdb2 597G 559G 7.8G 99% /home/mopar/biggerdaddy

So I plan on swapping out the 250g ext3store with a 1.5TB hard drive that I have seen as low as about $100 now. They will probably be cheaper when I buy one and I may even be able to get 2TB by then.

Read full topic
